characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 9+ Primary Save against Energy and Ballistic Weapons.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: Sarpenton Infantry Squads was better equipped and disciplined than the Valerius Alliance's Regiments at the start of the Sarpenton Conflict. An squad consists of 4-9 Riflemen armed with either Carbines or Locks, sometimes led by a Sergeant, and can be supported by a Weapon Specialist that wields the Energy-equivalent of an automatic rifle.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 10+ Primary Save against Melee and Ballistic Weapons.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: The Last Ditch Reserves or Conscripts of the Sarpenton Conglomerate were more than often Corporate or House Servants rather than forced civilians. These Conscripts were given cheap ballistic weapons of a by-gone era as to give them the means of offense and defense. A squad consists of 5-12 members, and then up to two special-trained Conscripts who wield ballistic weapons for suppression.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: Suppressive Fire (2), Ballistic, Light Machine Gun
characteristics.name: Abilities
Description
characteristics.$text:
For every OFFICER, VETERAN OFFICER, DYNASTY OFFICER and CORPO-MARSHALL, do the following:

At the start of the round, select one unit that is within true line of sight of a Officer/Officer Variant, which then takes an Intelligence Check, if they succeed, that selected unit gains +1 to Ballistic Skill, Melee Skill and Initiative until end of the round.


However, if no Officer/Officer Variants are present, at the start of the round, select one INFANTRY Unit, which then takes an Intelligence Check, if they succeed, that selected unit gains +1 to Ballistic Skill, Melee Skill and Initiative until end of the round.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text: The Sarpenton Army at the time of the First Pioneer War was the most technologically advanced militaries in the Myrian System. Every squad could be armed with dangerous energy weapons of various types that only the Elite of Societies or other Militaries could wield. Due to the abundance of resource, business and trade, the average riflemen was better educated, trained and drilled than any other.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: This Army-Wide Special Rule only applies to this Army Organization and stays in play even if the Army Commander is removed from play. You cannot have any other organization charts in addition to this unless a special rule says otherwise.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text: Those in leadership positions are encourage through many means to take charge and be independent in the battlefield, which added to their overall effectiveness. Due to the loose grip of high command, Sarpenton Officers are able to command their troops effectively and offer on-the-fly tactical knowledge. Even if a Sarpenton Officer is no longer present, a Sarpenton formation will follow suit in their leader's footsteps as they too try and mimic such tactical improvisation.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text: Corpo-Marshalls, or Corporate Command, is the active officers from the Sarpenton Conglomerate's businesses given field training. Living a life of political and economical strife, these officers are offered better training and resources while also having access to Corporate Reserves to add onto their own forces.

House Advantage: ALL INFANTRY Models that has a One-Handed Pistol gains +1 Initiative for Melee Combat.
House Disadvantage: If a model is in Melee Combat, it must use it's One-Handed Pistol weapon first, the weapon only using 1 WPN Dice.Then proceed with Melee Combat as normal, however those Pistols used cannot be used again this Melee Action.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: House Gansuu (Gan-Suu) is a proud house of Duelists that utilize pistols in their sword-fighting, unlike other houses that simply use a variety of melee weapons. However, rather than utilizing Pistols as a cheap trick, they use them to target weakpoints and fatigue the enemy with precision fire.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text:
House Advantage: ALL INFANTRY Models with the CONSCRIPT or INEXPERIENCED Keyword gains +1 to their Willpower and Discipline.

House Disadvantage: If an INEXPERIENCED or CONSCRIPT Unit fails a Willpower or Discipline test, select a SERGEANT or OFFICER Model that has line of sight and within twelve inches, that model then either performs a Melee Attack or a Shooting Attack that is applied to a singular model (If it is within a unit); the model does not get any Primary or Secondary Saves. If the model is killed by the OFFICER or SERGEANT model, one of two things happen:
If the model was in a unit: That Unit takes the Willpower or Discipline test that it previously failed, and then automatically succeeds; any Mental Test failure results are removed.
If the model was by itself: Select the nearest Unit or Model within 12 inches to gain an additional d10 on it's next Willpower or Discipline Test; and then this bonus is removed.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: House Masufai is known for it's ability to rally grand amounts of soldiers from even the most inexperienced populace, utilizing the same punishment as the enemy would inflict upon them; death. However, being killed by one from House Masufai is one of great honor as the House has stood alongside the ruling Dynastic House and never once has inspired disloyalty, and never will.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: At the start of Melee Combat, you use the Gansuu Blade-Shot at Initiative 10 for no additional costs, then proceed as normal.
characteristics.name: Description

characteristics.$text: A Masufai banner is an honor few get to uphold, Officers of the House see it as a great task to carry such a storied relic, while those who serve under them see it as a great blessing.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: Once per activation, the model equipped with the Tactical Scanner may choose to take an Intelligence Test. If it succeeds, then you select an Enemy unit within 24 inches and line of sight, that Enemy unit does not gain cover bonuses until the start of the next round.
characteristics.name: Description

rules.description: The Conscript Special Rule is ignored until this model is taken out of play.
rules.name: Honor-Disciplinary(Special Rule)

characteristics.$text: Honored Levies of House Masufai are those who are not apart of any military component of the Sarpenton Conglomerate, yet are called to assistance when House Masufai needs volunteers. Honored Levies are formed out of those who have seen previous service as Last Ditch support elements for House Masufai and have been personally trained and supplied by the House for their utter loyalty.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: Sarpenton Infantry Squads was better equipped and disciplined than the Valerius Alliance's Regiments at the start of the Sarpenton Conflict. An squad consists of 4-9 Riflemen armed with either Carbines or Locks, sometimes led by a Sergeant, and can be supported by a Weapon Specialist that wields the Energy-equivalent of an automatic rifle.

These Conscripts were given cheap ballistic weapons of a by-gone era as to give them the means of offense and defense. A squad consists of 5-12 members, and then up to two special-trained Conscripts who wield ballistic weapons for suppression.
characteristics.name: Lore

characteristics.$text: This armor provides a +1 to their Movement Characteristic and a 9+ Primary Save against Melee and Ballistic Weapons.
characteristics.name: Description
Description
characteristics.$text: This armor provides a 7+ Primary Save against Melee and Ballistic Weapons, however the model equipped suffers a -1 to their Initiative.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text:
House Advantage: All INFANTRY unit gain +1 to their movement, and any time they would have gain a Mental Status of any kind, it may be ignored. However, that unit (that ignores it) suffers d3 Damage with no saves or modifiers.

House Disadvantage: Any and all INFANTRY Models cannot use another friendly unit's characteristics for Mental Statuses, Tests and anything else that would require such.

characteristics.name: Lore
characteristics.$text: House Fumitae was once a great house, loyal to the throne and anyone who sat upon it, it's loyalty and well-trained reserves were unmatched until one day, their lord brought upon a coup against the Ruling Dynasty of the Second Era. After failing and those traitors being executed, those spared or given a second chance now seek redemption as unmarked and unbeloved by those who they wish forgiveness from.
This model (And the unit it joins) gains the Challenger Keyword. If this model/unit already had Challenger, it gains Glory in Combat (1), or Glory in Combat(+1) if it already had that as well.
characteristics.name: Description
